node.excerpt:
This love knew not the summer woods
      before it turned a falt’ring page
      for whispers of a blinding rage
had drowned its sights in…

By halfsweet song of winsome Spring, one blooms,
and unfurls pearled wings to the timshel’d skies,
A light divine — in reverie, one flies…

In fear and frost, a feeling seldom lies,
for snows of sorrow froze the starry night.
Through rigid mind rings out a frigid cry;
none bears…

frontmatter.title: the new Spring rose
frontmatter.subtitle: As such is Love, as such is Life

node.excerpt: Slowly—ever so slowly—it all began to turn to dust. It started in the fields. She almost could have missed the whole event, prancing in the…

On fleet-footed wings flees the singular night— 
hail Sun, a faith found by the dawn-laden light— 
as ochre lyre breathes out songs of life…

frontmatter.title: Ave Solis
frontmatter.subtitle: A Sapphic ode to the glory of a Sun
